title: Modular Inverse Calculator – Extended Euclidean Algorithm

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Extended Euclidean algorithm (high-level outline) Reduce the input \(a\) modulo \(m\): set \(a' = a \bmod m\). Initialize \(r_0 = a'\), \(r_1 = m\), \(s_0 = 1\), \(s_1 = 0\), \(t_0 = 0\), \(t_1 = 1\). Repeat until \(r_k = 0\): Compute the quotient \(q_k = \lfloor r_{k-1} / r_k \rfloor\). Update \(r_{k+1} = r_{k-1} - q_k r_k\). Update \(s_{k+1} = s_{k-1} - q_k s_k\), \(t_{k+1} = t_{k-1} - q_k t_k\). When the loop ends, the last non-zero remainder is \(\gcd(a', m)\), and the corresponding \(s\) is the inverse.
